A/V: 10/10, perfect!

+1

The good:

- Picture quality is correct, there is no obvious blocking artifacts. But considering the huge bitrate, this is expected.

- The source has been debanded. Not enough in some scenes, but it's still better than most other releases.

The bad:

- There is no small detail in this show so 1080p is completely useless. The upscale could have be done with a more sophisticated upscaler to take advantage of a heavy offline processing but this is not the case. You can see low-resolution aliasing everywhere. 720 lines would have been more than enough, actually there isn't even detail loss at half resolution (540 lines).

The ugly:

- Original animation framerate is 23.976 fps, not 29.97. Doing half the IVTC process results in jerky motion everywhere, it's a real shame.

Conclusion:

Considering the huge amount of data and the relatively poor quality, I would recommend to save your bandwidth & disk space and stick to a decent 720p stream.
